doc: Modernize steps to be followed after release

Remove old references to sourceforge, add what actually should be done
and provide some more details.

issue.title: [Qt] Fix Start bitcoin on system login
issue.body:
Fixes #4243.

I could reproduce the bug, at least with my compiler the problem was that "LINUX" was not defined.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4626_e1eb741e342ef25e510db6c06935afc4116abd74/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

Tests PASSED? On a documentation-only pull?

ACK.
@TheBlueMatt is this a tested or untested ack? :D

I just rely on pull tested to do my testing. 

On August 4, 2014 1:38:53 PM PDT, Pieter Wuille notifications@github.com wrote:

> @TheBlueMatt is this a tested or untested ack? :D
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/4626#issuecomment-51114122
You dropped the "update download sizes on bitcoin.org". I don't know if we need to have them at all, but if we keep them we should make sure they're kept up to date.
Yes, I removed that on purpose as I couldn't find any download sizes on the mentioned page. Do you know what it is talking about?

Oh I see now, just out of horizontal scroll range in the html
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin.org/bitcoin.org/_templates/download.html

This is something that could be updated automatically.

But my preference would be to remove them.
